item.description:
To celebrate its cameo apperance in "My Best Friend's Girl" starring Kate Hudson and Dane Cook, the Beantown Swing Orchestra will make a special appearance at Boston Swing Central on September 12. Most of the songs will be new material freshly transcribed by their trumpeter Danny Fratina from the original 15-piece Benny Goodman Orchestra recordings of 1935-1938, with tempos between 150 and 190 bpm.

The movie comes out in theaters one week later, on September 19. See them in the trailer at www.mybestfriendsgirlmovie.com.

There will be a beginner swing dance lesson from 8 to 9pm, and no partner or experience is required. Since the followers (usually women) rotate through the leaders (usually men), the lesson is a great way to meet people before the music starts.

The band plays from 9:30 to 11:30pm, with DJ music during the breaks.

It's in Central Square in Cambridge, conveniently located right off the Red Line.

Admission is $13 ($10 for students and seniors).
item.how_to_find_us: I will be directing the band.

group.name: The Boston-Area Swing/Blues Dance Meetup Group

item.name: Swing Dance in Central Square, Cambridge
